row.description: For those searching for a Vegas experience closer to the East Coast, Atlantic City on the Jersey Shore comes up a winner. Whether you're looking for an exclusive casino or a gaming palace done up in a wild west theme, you'll find it here. If you're on a quest for nightlife, look no further than the city's thumpin' clubs. Then rise with the sun (if you went to sleep at all) and stroll the famous boardwalk while waves lap tranquil beaches.

The Mississippi Gulf Coast, one of America's most affordable vacation getaways, is where you'll discover vibrant Biloxi. Gaming fans flock to its casinos to try their hand at high limit tables and liberal house rules. Enjoy all the amenities high rollers have come to expect in the city's sumptuously appointed resort hotels. Spend your winnings dining and taking in top-notch entertainment. Biloxi's the place for gaming fun with a southern twist.

It's all about gaming southern style in Shreveport, Louisiana. Climb aboard one of the city's five Red River riverboat casinos, where you'll enjoy state-of-the-art entertainment in a setting that evokes the glamour of the past. When you've had your fill at the tables, hop on over to catch some horse-racing at Louisiana Downs in nearby Bossier City. Need to unwind? Botanical gardens and fine dining beckon those looking for relaxation.

Laughlin, Nevada, nestled on the banks of the Colorado River, attracts gaming enthusiasts with the affordable charms of eleven resort casinos. When you arrive, hop on a water shuttle to visit gaming houses tricked out with all the latest attractions. After you've cashed out your winnings, enjoy some superb recreation, including hiking beautiful Grapevine Canyon. Known as a great alternative to Vegas, Laughlin is blessed with natural splendor.

row.site: Casinos, Cars and Culture in the Motor City
row.description: Detroit, famous for muscle cars and Motown, is increasingly known as the gaming enthusiast's destination of choice. Play the tables in any number of the city's superb hotel casinos, then check the exchange rate and hop over to the Canadian gaming hub of Windsor, Ontario, just a short trip away aboard the Ambassador Bride. When you're on a quest for great values in the Motor City, luck is on your side.

Where can you enjoy world class food, shopping, shows, and gaming in hotels that make your jaw drop? It's Vegas, baby! Find out why Las Vegas delivers sensational entertainment to over 37 million visitors a year. Try your luck on nickel slots or go head to head with the high rollers. Kick back where Sinatra hung his hat or spot celebrities at the Strip's hottest clubs. Whatever your definition of a good time, Vegas provides it in spades.

Sure, casinos around the world offer live entertainment, but when you're in New Orleans, some of the best music in the world is a block or two away. When you've had your fill of jazz, hit the tables at Harrah's, where you'll choose from 2,000 slot machines, 90 table games, and the largest poker room in the South. The Big Easy also offers riverboat gambling and the country's second oldest horse racing track at the New Orleans Fair Grounds.

row.site: Rio Mar Beach Resort and Casino.
row.description: Where can you play Texas Hold 'Em within walking distance of a rainforest? Puerto Rico, that's where. With fifteen casinos dotting the island, this tropical oasis hosts the annual Caribbean Gaming Conference. Explore the island's jungles, tennis courts, championship golf courses, and fresh cuisine from the sea, all just a minute or two from some of the most gorgeous beaches on earth. Puerto Rico is where gaming enthusiasts stay to play.

A family-friendly escape with just as much glitter as Vegas, Reno makes memories. Maybe you'll remember striking it big at blackjack or at the roulette table, or just the perfect day at the spa. Those in search of sumptuous amenities in this gaming getaway will discover them at any number of top-rated casino hotels. In your time away from the tables, take in some of the region's mining town history or state-of-the-art entertainment.

From cabins to casinos, South Lake Tahoe offers sophistication amid rugged grandeur. Looking for a gaming experience that doesn't involve the glitz? Step up to the tables at any of Tahoe's casino hotels and experience an elevated style of gaming. Then, winnings in hand, satiate your hunger at restaurants where celebrities enjoy the creations of celebrity chefs. Gaming equals good times in this ski-and-be-seen mountain getaway.

Monte Carlo is synonymous with wealth, opulence, glitz, and glamour. It's the wealthiest enclave of Monaco, which boasts the most expensive real estate on Earth. Dress to the nines and hit the Monte Carlo Casino, where you'll have a better-than-outside chance of spotting royalty or celebrities. While here, catch one of Monte Carlo's signature sporting events, including the F1 Monaco Grand Prix and the Monte Carlo Tennis Masters.

If the Bahaman sun should prove too bright, head for some indoor recreation in the country's fabled casinos. Play blackjack, craps, and roulette at Atlantis Paradise Island, a luxurious retreat with 90 table games and more than 1,000 slot machines. Then seek out the sports book at Crystal Palace Casino in Nassau, the area's largest casino and resort. Or strike it big in the Princess Casino, a 20,000 square foot Moorish-style gaming palace.

A little-known fact: Aruba was the birthplace of Caribbean Stud Poker, which first appeared in 1988. The island is home to 11 casinos, many of which are open 24 hours. Try your luck in the Excelsior Casino's exclusive poker room. If you tire of the tables at the Hyatt Regency Casino, repair to the Copa Cabana Bar to savor a hand-rolled cigar. Or pull up a seat at one of the 32 gaming tables at Stellaris Casino, Aruba's largest.

Niagara Falls is much more than just a series of mind-boggling waterfalls - it's also a casino-rich gaming destination. Explore the many casinos of neighboring Ontario, which has more casinos and gaming establishments than any other province in Canada. Or stay close to the Falls; three casinos are located adjacent to the area, and several casino hotels are located within steps of this natural wonder.

Calgary's reputation is steeped in cowboy traditions - saloons, country music, and the like. But casino gambling is becoming increasingly popular in this Alberta outpost. Play the odds at the Cash Casino, where 600 slot machines and 28 table games are ready to pay out. Or head to Casino Calgary, a massive, 52,000 square foot gaming space with 760 slots and 30 table games. Finally, the Deerfoot Inn Casino offers 680 slots and four restaurants.

Macau's gambling reputation is second only to that of Las Vegas. This Chinese jurisdiction has become known as "the Monte Carlo of the Orient," and its name is well-earned. Choose among 28 casinos in the area, including the brand-new Wynn Macau, the MGM Grand Macau, and the Sands Macau. Whether you're a high roller - and there are plenty of them here - or a nickel slot fan, Macau's gorgeous casinos have a stool for you.

Venture to the doorstep of the Inca Trail and experience the excitement of gaming in Peru. Lima's casinos are many, but begin with the Sheraton Hotel, which offers 40 gaming tables and 180 slots. Roll the dice at Marriott's Stellaris Hotel and Casino, where each guest room features an ocean view. Don't miss downtown's Los Delfines Hotel and Casino and its onsite "dolphinarium," which is home to a pair of resident dolphins.

The town of Utrecht, Netherlands has begun to carve out a niche as a luxury destination for gaming enthusiasts from across Europe. Should you tire of the four first-class casinos - including Casino Utrecht, with 83 table games and 1,040 slot machines - you can always explore the historical center of Utrecht, the de facto religious capital of Holland since the 700s. And you can always place a winning bet on the beauty of the Netherlands' countryside.

Travel to one of Europe's oldest and grandest casinos in the German city of Baden-Baden. Casino Baden's 29 gaming tables and hundreds of slot machines are set in the Baden Kongresshaus, a grand Victorian building that was renovated in 2007. Play poker, blackjack, roulette, and other table games amongst a distinguished clientele - Casino Baden-Baden regularly attracts celebrities from Europe and beyond.

Russia's recent economic growth has resulted in an impressive casino boom. Bring your black tie to the ritzy Casino Metropol, a gaming paradise near the Kremlin and Red Square. Come prepared - Metropol has a strict dress code and $25 minimums on its poker and roulette tables. Or venture 10 minutes from downtown to Hotel Orlyonok, Moscow's largest hotel/casino complex, which also has 15 restaurants, six bowling alleys, and a sprawling pool.

Europe's most populous city has a nightlife to match its size. Catch an unforgettable musical, show, or play at one of the city's 100 historical theaters, or discover the hottest visual art in the world at any of 200+ galleries. Crazy about museums? London has more than 300. And if you crave events - be they artistic, cultural, or sports - London has them, to the tune of 150 every day. New York may never sleep, but London never stands still.

row.site: Centre Pompidou and the Rodin Museum
row.description: If Paris's museums, cafes, and monuments don't impress you, its shopping will. Expand your wardrobe in the world's fashion capital, and come home looking better than ever. Between shops, pay visits to Notre Dame de Paris, the Eiffel Tower, and the Arc de Triomphe - three of the most recognizable monuments on Earth. Oh, and those museums? They're some of the best in the world, too - especially the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, and the Rodin Museum.

Copenhagen, the Scandinavian equivalent of Paris or London, is a booming metropolis that remains rooted in its history. Discover the many chambers and ballrooms of Rosenborg Castle, home to the Danish Royal Collections. Feel the presence of the Vikings at the Viking Ship Museum, where the remnants of legendary vessels are on display. Or scratch your shopping itch at the Stroget, a market that runs directly through the heart of this bustling city.

row.site: Rome is the capitol of Italy
row.description: Italy's capital has seen its share of boom and bust - the city was founded in 753 BC. Immerse yourself in Rome's narrow streets, many of which are lined with sidewalk cafes, chic boutiques, and wine bars. Explore the towering nave of St. Peter's Basilica, located in Vatican City, a sovereign territory of the Catholic Church that is the world's smallest nation. And experience the majesty of the Coliseum, the Roman Empire's signature stadium.

From Darling Harbour to Oxford Street, Sydney is alive with pubs, jazz haunts, and nightclubs. Stroll along Sydney Harbour and marvel at the stacked eggshell roof of the Sydney Opera House, the hub of the city's cultural activity. Spend the weekend perusing the nearby Rocks neighborhood, a historical district laden with boutiques, galleries, cafes, and a seasonal outdoor market. However you choose to kick back, Sydney gladly assists.

row.site: CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame
row.description: Toronto offers cultural activities and entertainment options galore. From Broadway shows in the Entertainment District to shopping at the expansive Eaton Centre, Toronto will never leave you at a loss for things to do. Explore the city's signature attractions, including the 1,825-foot CN Tower (the tallest structure in the Americas), the Hockey Hall of Fame, and the famous St. Lawrence Farmer's Market, founded in 1803.

Often referred to as "the Paris of South America," Buenos Aires integrates European architecture and arts with the customs and traditions of Argentina and its Continental neighbors. Experience the glory of an opera in Teatro Colon, a world-famous opera house. Savor Argentina's steaks, wines, and coffees in the city's burgeoning dining scene, and finish your days with a tango at a nightclub - the dance, after all, was invented in Buenos Aires.

From the dancers and musicians in El ZÃ³calo to the floating gardens of Xochimilco, Mexico City teems with life, diversity, and art. Experience the baroque architecture of the Centro Historico, visit the Frida Kahlo Museum, and catch a live performance of the renowned National Symphony Orchestra at the Palacio de Bellas Artes. Finally, don't miss the Paseo de la Reforma, a stunning boulevard that was modeled after the Champs-Elysees.

Vancouver sits at the junction of the civilized and natural worlds. Downtown, you'll find chic shops, excellent dining, and packed nightclubs on Robson Street. Yet a quick bus ride brings you to the forests and gardens of Stanley Park, a 1,000-acre urban oasis blessed with more than 500,000 trees. Then hop on a foot ferry to the public market and craft studios of Granville Island, or visit the Vancouver Art Museum, home to a 7,900-item collection.

Strut your stuff - or watch others strut theirs - in Sao Paulo, the unofficial fashion capital of South America. (The city hosts one of the world's top Fashion Weeks, and supermodel Gisele Bundchen was discovered here.) Sample Sao Paulo's sophisticated cuisine, which ranges all the way from Chinese to French - and from fast food to haute cuisine. In all, the city is home to more than 12,000 restaurants serving 62 different types of cuisine.

Barcelona's undisputed claims to fame are the fantastical buildings of Antonio Gaudi, the renowned Spanish architect who designed a series of neo-gothic structures near the city center. Stroll the Passieg de Gracia, where La Pedrera and Casa Batlio, two of Gaudi's most famous works, await. Or simply jump into Barcelona's thriving cafe and bar culture - sip a beer at a sidewalk table in the Gracia district and watch the world go by.

Hit New York City for the definitive urban adventure, whether that means catching Broadway musicals or experimental plays, shopping at the world's highest of high end stores, or just marveling at the lights in Times Square. Bargains on museums, galleries, concerts, and sporting events can be found any day of the week. And be sure to bring your appetite - the world's greatest chefs and the perfect hot dog alike can be found in the Big Apple.

With streets lined with palms, Los Angeles is an ultra-happening haven to stars and those who seek them. But it's also a world-class cultural capital, where you can spend the day absorbed in art at the J. Paul Getty Center or absorb the rays in bohemian Venice Beach. Nibble cuisine at one of countless celebrity-haunted eateries around town, or hit shops on Rodeo Drive or in funky Melrose. This home to Hollywood is the place to see and be seen.

From the top of Sears Tower to the shores of Lake Michigan, Chicago is a city made for urban adventurers. Explore the city from the El, and don't miss Wrigley Field and the Art Institute. Stroll the Magnificent Mile for fine dining among historical landmarks, or venture to Millennium Park, where celebrity architects have created an inspiring urban playground. Looking for nightlife? You'll dig the Second City's hot blues clubs.

Those on a quest for the ultra hip need look no further than San Francisco. From the Beat Generation haunts of North Beach to the trendy Union Square core, you'll discover colorful characters, adventurous cuisine, and architectural wonders around every picturesque corner. Visitors of all persuasions enjoy strolling out-and-proud Castro Street, and no trip would be complete without taking in the majestic Golden Gate Bridge from the park.

If you know Seattle only for its coffee and software, you've just started to experience the energy and originality this urban hot spot has to offer. Start among the produce stalls and buskers at Pike Place Market, or rock out at the Experience Music Project. Spend the day in a kayak on Lake Union or take in the skyline and mountains from the Space Needle, then head downtown for superb shopping and the region's coolest indie music scene.

Southern hospitality meets global sophistication in Atlanta, Georgia. Start your visit downtown, where news junkies can make a pilgrimage to CNN Center and the whole family will enjoy the marvels at World of Coca-Cola®. Ready to shop? Venture to the high-end Buckhead district for classy boutiques amid gorgeous southern mansions. Be sure to hit the High Art Museum, too. It's just one of many examples of the city's passion for the arts.

Salsa dancing, art deco architecture, and wide stretches of sand - where else can you be but Miami? The city's nightlife is glorious and notorious, drawing spirited pleasure seekers from around the world. Linger over dinner at any number of fine dining destinations, and discover the newest trends in this fashion epicenter. Whether you're looking for a shopping adventure or are on a quest for the best Cuban music, Miami's big-city beat is calling.

row.site: Faneuil Hall is a collection of boutiques.
row.description: Urban sophisticates and sophisticated sports fans consider Boston a must-see destination. It's not hard to see why. The Boston Pops is one of the world's most renowned orchestras, and Red Sox Nation has been unrelenting since their curse-breaking 2004 World Series victory. You won't want to miss Fanueuil Hall to shop its boutiques and pushcart vendors, and a visit to Harvard Yard's overstuffed bookstores is a must for serious readers.

Resilient and brilliant, New Orleans lets nothing stop its vibrant nightlife. It all starts with America's most creative music and food. Catch a stellar jam session at Preservation Hall, then savor shrimp etouffee in one of the French Quarter's Creole eateries. Explore the stately architecture of the Garden District or tour an old plantation on the outskirts of town. Locals call it "Nawlins." You'll call it the most fun you've had in ages.

Whether you're liberal or conservative, there's one thing you'll find agreement about - Washington, D.C. means business when it comes to urban fun. When you've had your fill of monuments and museums, enjoy waterfront shopping and nightlife in Georgetown. Experience a show in the grandeur of the Kennedy Center. Hungry? Catch a glimpse at who's dining at the next table in top-rated steak houses where Capitol Hill's power brokers gather.

row.site: Food in Paris isn't restricted to French food.
row.description: Paris's culinary delights are legendary. The city is home to Le Cordon Bleu, a renowned cooking academy, and it's where Julia Child first rose to stardom. Browse the city's lively markets and discover bakeries, cheese shops, and wine bars. When the dinner bell tolls, choose from countless bistros, haute cuisine hotspots, and neighborhood cafes. Prepare for variety, too - Parisian restaurants serve cuisines from across the globe.

Rome's delightful cuisine is reflective of Italy's varied culture. Begin your gourmet experience in Rome with a trip to the Campo de' Fiori, a picturesque outdoor market where stalls overflow with fruits, vegetables, meats, cheeses, and breads. Head to a sidewalk cafe for a wood-fired Neapolitan pizza and a glass of Prosecco. And finish your day with a dish of spaghetti carbonara and a bottle of Barolo, one of the country's signature red wines.

Located on the shores of the Mediterranean - and in the heart of Spain's vibrant Catalonia region - Barcelona is a city obsessed with food. Walk into any one of the city's casual tapas bars, where small plates of local delicacies are served in warm, inviting atmospheres. Or score a seat at an exotic bistro - the city is loaded with cutting-edge cuisine. However you define gourmet, Barcelona has a table for you.

Rio's beaches and nightlife are justly celebrated, but the city's cuisine alone is worth the trip. You'll find loads of international flavors here, but Brazilian cooking takes center stage. Sample the Feijoada, a beef, pork, and bean stew served with rice and kale. Don't miss the rollicking churrascarias, which serve grilled meats and vegetables. Finally, walk the length of Ipanema beach, where waterfront eateries serve superb grilled seafood.

row.site: Yarra Valley, renouned wine region in Southern Australia.
row.description: Bring your appetite for culinary adventure to Melbourne's Chinatown, located in the city center, which is loaded with top-flight Chinese, Malaysian, Thai, Vietnamese, Indonesian, and Japanese restaurants. Embark on a day of wine tasting in the Yarra Valley, 30 minutes east of the city, where you'll discover excellent chardonnay and pinot noir. Finally, head to St. Kilda, a seaside neighborhood dotted with cozy pubs and seafood houses.

Vancouver is one of Canada's most diverse cities - over half of its residents speak a first language other than English. So it only makes sense that the city's cuisine would be as multicultural as its population. Sample the city's fresh seafood, sushi, and Indian cuisine or explore bistro-laden Davie Street in the bustling West End district. Still hungry? Hit Robson Street to enjoy sweet or savory crêpes, perfect any time of day.

British Columbia's Okanagan Valley is beginning to turn wine lovers' heads. Explore the world's northernmost winemaking region, home to 74 wineries. Winemakers here craft vintages that are reminiscent of those found in Germany, Austria, France, and Italy, guaranteeing you'll have a delightfully worldly tasting experience. And you can't go wrong when you dine in charming eateries specializing in the perfect fare to complement your glass of vino.

British Columbia's Okanagan Valley is beginning to turn wine lovers' heads. Explore the world's northernmost winemaking region, home to 74 wineries. Winemakers here craft vintages that are reminiscent of those found in Germany, Austria, France, and Italy, guaranteeing you'll have a delightfully worldly tasting experience. And you can't go wrong when you dine in charming eateries specializing in the perfect fare to complement your glass of vino.

Famous for its French cuisine, St. Martin is widely recognized as the culinary capital of the Caribbean. Feast on a menu that is as widely varied as the island's colorful history, with Creole, Dutch, English, and farther-flung influences. After dinner, belly up to a beachfront bar and order a glass of the legendary Guavaberry liqueur, a folk beverage made from local berries and rum. Yum!

The Bahamas offer a wealth of superb restaurants. Experience the Caribbean's only five-star restaurant: Graycliff, a mansion built in 1742 that features a 250,000-bottle wine cellar and award-winning cigar factory. For a more affordable night out, sample some of the local seafood, including conch, a tasty white meat from a large ocean mollusk that's often served in salads, chowders, gumbos, or burgers.

row.site: Hong Kong has a reputation of Gourmet Paradise
row.description: Hong Kong's cuisine is an incredible melange of cultures, ideas, and ingredients. Experience Dim Sum, an Asian tradition of steamed meats, seafood, and vegetables served by a rotating cast of waiters. Dine at a famed haute cuisine establishment helmed by a world-famous chef for a meal that you will never forget. Or simply partake of the daily Yum Cha ("drinking tea") that is an integral part of Hong Kong life.

Miami is where the flavors of the Caribbean and Latin America come to dance. Dine on fish caught just that morning off the coast, prepared by a master chef. Experience every meaning of the word "salsa" in epicurean hangouts where the food - and music - are hot. But it's not all delectable Cuban cuisine in this worldly way station for hungry travelers. You'll discover some of the most delicious Italian, Thai, and Mediterranean dishes here as well.

row.site: Chocolate is New York City's leading specialty-food export.
row.description: New York City is the city for serious foodies. Grab breakfast on your way to the subway in any of the city's eateries specializing in comfort food. For hot corned beef on rye or the bagel by which all other bagels are measured, you can't go wrong at any of the city's famous kosher delis. Dinner time? Hit top-rated steak houses and order yours medium rare. Then, for dessert, taste heaven one sample at time at Manhattan's legendary chocolatiers.

San Francisco welcomes adventurous palates. Explore the Noe Valley neighborhood, where world-renowned chefs turn farm-fresh ingredients into masterpieces. If you're in the mood for sweet and sour, head to Chinatown, the dim sum mecca. Fall for the Mission District's famously filling (and affordable) burritos, or the hottest of California Street's haute cuisine. This is the city where bold international flavors dare to be original.

Houston, we've got an appetite. Recently rated by ForbesTraveler.com as one of the best restaurant cities in America, this gourmand's getaway offers more than 5,000 eateries representing more than 35 countries and American regions. Start with a Texas-sized steak at one of the city's legendary steakhouses or try some world-class sushi. And it may be stating the obvious, but this is the city to satisfy your craving for Tex-Mex.

Infused with flavors from Italy, Eastern Europe, and the American heartland, Chicago lures epicureans looking for memorable meals. Grab a Polish sausage at Wrigley Field, or sample the international fare downtown. Sink your teeth into some thick-crusted Chicago-style pizza or slice into sirloin at one of the city's legendary steakhouses. Interested in dessert? There's nothing more delicious than a slice of Windy City cheesecake.

row.site: More restaurants are open in New Orleans than ever before
row.description: New Orleans, where Cajun and Creole cuisine were born, is where epicureans come to dine. Seek out the joints where celebrity chefs like Emeril Lagasse, Paul Prudhome, and John Besh deliver once-in-a-lifetime culinary experiences. Even off-the-beaten path restaurants serve up mouth-watering jambalayas, etouffes, and the tastiest cornbread on the Mississippi. One tip - seek out the bananas foster. It's on fire. Literally!

row.site: Star watch at famous restaurants like the Ivy.
row.description: Los Angeles feeds famous appetites, and is famous for its fresh and healthy food. Here the best dishes of Mexico and Asia come to party. Journey to Olvera street for crunchy taquitos or sip sake at any number of the city's refined sushi bars. The City of Angels offers both grab-and-go burgers way tastier than they have to be and spa cuisine at high-end eateries where stars strike deals. Discover for yourself why foodies live and dine in LA.

Dining has been redefined in Las Vegas. Sure, you can still grab affordable (and incredibly tasty) buffet fare, but the past decade has seen a migration of the world's greatest chefs to the Strip. Let master sommeliers guide your wine experience in restaurants so beautifully designed you'll forget you're in a casino. Let others hit the jackpot at the blackjack table. The true treasure here is the worldly cuisine.

The rolling fields of Napa Valley beckon many a wine-lover, with hundreds of wineries to choose from. But something has to go with the wine, right? Start with five-star The French Laundry, where fresh, meticulously-selected local ingredients are transformed into gustatory wonders. Drop in on countless chic bistros and order what's in season. You'll always find the perfect complement to whatever you're drinking.

A food revolution is underway in Portland, Oregon. Locally-grown, organic ingredients are on the menu everywhere - even the burger joints make their fries with spuds grown in the Willamette Valley. Sip the products of Oregon's wine country in hip, downtown wine bars. Explore Asian, Mediterranean, and vegan flavors at one of the city's food festivals or farmers' markets. And beer lovers take note - Portland's microbreweries rule.

Jamaica's beaches are the stuff of legend. Where else can you lounge in the sand on James Bond Beach before retiring to the bar at the Goldeneye Hotel, where Bond writer Ian Fleming once lived? After indulging your inner 007, visit Blue Lagoon Beach, which hosted Brooke Shields during the filming of Blue Lagoon. Or take a dip at Seven Mile Beach, a '60s hotspot that still sports a carefree vibe - and the occasional nude sunbather.

Retreat to Cancún's famed white sand beaches, which are now more spacious than ever. (Local tourism officials doubled the width of the area's beaches in 2005.) Bask in the region's perfect temperatures - which average 78 degrees year-round - and snorkel, swim, and dive in Cancún's crystal-clear Caribbean waters. Whether you dig beaches, islands, water, sun, or all of the above, Cancún has it all.

The beaches of the Bahamas are famous for their sugar-white sand, sparkling waters, and jet set sunbathers. (An exception to the white-sand beaches: gorgeous Pink Sands Beach, on Grand Bahamas Island.) Fly by seaplane to the Out Islands, where you can angle for bonefish on tropical sands so secluded you may not see another person. Or visit a protected beach and learn about the efforts to conserve the islands' beautiful coral reefs.

Set sail for the Greek Islands, the mythical home of the goddess Hera - on the island of Samos, you can explore the ruins of the Heraion, a temple dedicated to the goddess. But don't spend too long on Samos; Greece has more than 1,400 other islands, with countless miles of unspoiled shoreline. Be sure to revel in the quiet coves, pulsating clubs, and romantic bistros of Santorini and Mykonos, the country's two most popular isles.

Experience Canadian coastal living at its best in Victoria, a seaside city that offers myriad opportunities for sailing, fishing, kayaking, and whale-watching. Amble through the immaculate grounds of the Butchart Gardens, a 55-acre garden that's home to blooming flora year-round. Stroll Victoria's historical harbor and explore its vibrant downtown. However you choose to relax, you'll do it in comfort: Victoria has the mildest climate in Canada.

Escape to the famous sands of Rio de Janiero, one of the world's most iconic beachfront destinations. Catch some rays on Ipanema Beach, which gave its name to the bossa nova classic "The Girl from Ipanema." Walk the white sands of Copacabana Beach, ranked as one of the world's top ten. In February, the famous Carnival fills the streets with parades and all-night parties, but Rio's carefree, high-spirited atmosphere persists throughout the year.

Costa Rica is home to many different sands - here you'll find white, gray, beige, brown, and even black sand. Tickle your toes in the sugary stuff on the country's Caribbean side, or explore tide pools on the rocky stretches of the Pacific coast. Discover beachfront luxury at Tamarindo, where you can view sea turtles, catch waves, and delight in tropical mango scrubs. And don't miss Jaco Beach, replete with waves, nightclubs, and top-flight dining.

The Mexican sun seems to shine brighter on the Riviera Maya. Relax on Tulum's lengthy beaches, which are free of crashing surf and lie within minutes of the area's Mayan ruins. Stay in a beachside cabana at the budget-friendly Xpu-Ha Beach area, a rustic community that caters to backpackers and adventurers. Or simply grab a margarita and kick back beneath a beach umbrella at Playa del Carmen, a quaint seaside village.

It's hard to argue against a place that gets over 300 days of sun every year, has spacious white-sand beaches and a vibrant culture blending Spanish, Dutch, and Indian influences. Restore your peace of mind at Baby Beach, which sits on a shallow, clear lagoon where you can snorkel amongst parrot fish, angel fish, and assorted tropical species. Or head to Manchebo Beach, a wide, sandy oasis that's Aruba's only topless sunning spot.

Phuket, an island province located in Southern Thailand, offers miles of pristine tropical shores and affordable lodgings. Snorkel, scuba, and swim the days away on palm-lined beaches, renowned for their clear waters and sparkling sands. Pamper yourself with beachfront massages and spa treatments at one of the area's superb luxury resorts, or indulge your passion for shopping at the Jungycelon Shopping Mall, home to over 200 name-brand stores.

Located on the Southern tip of Mexico's Baja California, Los Cabos offers some of the Pacific coast's most picturesque beaches. Pack a picnic and a bottle of wine before taking a boat to the secluded Lover's Beach, which offers incredible views of nearby natural rock arches. Or share the sunshine with the family at Playa el Medano, a calm and popular swimming spot. But if hanging ten is your M.O., then don't miss Los Cerritos, a premier surfing beach.

Myrtle Beach boasts 60 - count 'em, 60 - miles of white sandy beaches. As if that wasn't enough, this perennial vacation paradise lures visitors with more than 100 courses worthy of the pros. Traveling with kids? Put the putter in their hands at any of the 46 fun-themed courses. Whether you'd like to get out of a sand trap or let the little ones bury you in sand, this Atlantic coast getaway is serious fun.

St. Petersburg, Florida has a reputation as a spring break mecca, luring visitors with its powdery sands. But it's also an oasis of calm, a warm-weather destination of lush gardens and farmers' markets. For an even more low-key getaway, head to nearby Clearwater, a romantic seaside village ideal for taking in the sunset. With an abundance of shopping, golf, and family entertainment, these Gulf Coast beach retreats promise a relaxing escape.

Instead of a welcome mat, Fort Lauderdale spreads out 23 miles of sun-kissed beaches. Start the day with some snorkeling and discover the sea life teeming just below the surface. Stroll the sands at dusk, then head to the Riverwalk Arts and Entertainment district, where you can shop at luxury boutiques and dine in top-notch eateries. It's easy to get around in this canal-laced city - just grab a water taxi and set your course for adventure.

When you first set foot in Cape Cod, you'll find a string of villages full of weathered shingles, whaling captains' mansions, lobster shacks, and upscale dining discoveries. Go on a quest to find the most picturesque lighthouse amid the wind-swept dunes. Find out for yourself what makes Martha's Vineyard the preferred weekend escape for the well-connected. And don't miss the famously charming village of Nantucket.

row.site: A quick flight from the US mainland
row.description: You can drive around the coast of Puerto Rico in a day, but why hurry through one of the world's greatest adventure escapes? Hit Caña Gorda beach for scuba diving and other family-oriented water sport activities. Hike into lush Guanica Forest Reserve and swim through the bioluminescent lagoon at Vieques. Or head inland to sip the offerings at coffee plantations or the harder stuff at any number of friendly bars and restaurants.

Surfers trek to San Diego's 70 miles of beaches to catch the perfect wave, but there's more to the city than hanging ten. Head over to the Children's Pool to watch seals and sea lions sunning themselves, or stroll the boardwalk at Mission Beach. Take an introductory scuba course at the gentle La Jolla shores, home to an ecological preserve. When you've had your fill of surf, San Diego beckons with ample food, shopping, and entertainment.

Sunshine, sand, and salsa make Miami a beach lover's paradise. Start at South Beach, the world famous recreation capital. Take a dip in the warm ocean waves, then immerse yourself in the music of Little Havana or sample delectable modern cuisine in the Art Deco District. Kids will love a trip to the zoo, while adults will enjoy a zoo of another sort - Miami's exuberant nightlife, spilling from numerous bars and nightclubs.

Visitors yearning for relaxation - and more than 300 species of birds - flock to South Padre Island, off the southern tip of Texas. Don't forget your bird guide and binoculars! In this ecologically rich getaway you can go horseback riding on the beach, hike, parasail, scuba dive, golf, or try your hand at deep sea fishing. After a day lazing along the 34 miles of beach, sample the fresh seafood at any number of excellent restaurants with outdoor seating.

You're going to wish that "aloha" didn't also mean "goodbye" when you venture to Oahu. Start by bathing in sunshine on world famous Waikiki Beach. Name the water activity and you'll find it on Hawaii's most populous island, from snorkeling to parasailing, surfing to sunset cruises. Get off the well-worn path with a hike to Makapuu Lighthouse on the South Shore or take hula lessons on the beach. You'll come to believe that Oahu means paradise.

Dip your toes in the sapphire shallows off Magens Bay Beach. Watch the palms sway while sipping a banana daiquiri prepared with Cruzan rum. Are you in paradise? Close. When your journey takes you to St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, you'll pinch yourself to make sure you're not dreaming. Don't miss Drake's Seat, the vantage point where Sir Francis Drake watched his fleet. You, on the other hand, will be watching a breathtaking sunset.

You've never seen Venice like this. Roam the city that the European Renaissance revealed as a hotbed of intrigue, mystery, and sweepingly romantic vistas. Experience gorgeous architectural and historical structures by day while getting a glimpse of the city's secret history by night. From Gondola tours in shimmering canals to molten stoves in glassblowing studios, the glorious history of Venice will come alive for you.

Pack your bags for a journey like no other as you discover the history, beauty, and intrigue of China. Gaze upon imperial treasures, travel by rickshaw, and dine on traditional cuisine. Discover all Beijing has to offer, including the Temple of Heaven, legendary Tiananmen Square, and the Forbidden City. From the frenetic energy of Shanghai to the magnificent Great Wall of China, your adventures in this enchanting country await.

Explore Egypt's ancient civilization and the world's most iconic monuments. Visit awe-inspiring World Heritage sites and marvel at the country's rugged grandeur. Immerse yourself in the local culture by wandering Cairo's bazaars, or visit one of the ancient wonders of the world—the magnificent pyramids. From a Nile cruise to urban excursions, the cultural treasures and stunning landscapes of Egypt are waiting to be discovered.

With a rich mix of culture, natural beauty, and archaeological wonder, India is a world-class destination drawing visitors from around the globe. Embark on an adventure to one of the world's last remaining tiger habitats, or visit the humbling ghats of Varnasi. Escape to the World Heritage sites of Fatehpur Sikri and the magnificent Taj Majal. From rugged hillsides to man-made structures that will leave you in awe, your adventures in India await.

From sweeping desert vistas to ancient artifacts, Jordan is a country filled with new discoveries. Embark on a fascinating day trip from Amman to the ancient city of Jerash—only an hour away, but a trip 2000 years back in time. Walk the grounds believed to be the sites of five ancient biblical cities—Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, Zebouin, and Zoar. Explore Jordan's treasures and meet its people on a wonder-filled trip of a lifetime.

Explore the undiscovered side of Mexico. Walk amongst the ruins of the ancient cities of Chichen Itza, Uxmal, and Coba. Take a side trip to explore the Cenote Dzitnup, a subterranean cavern filled with crystal blue water. Then experience the pristine beaches of Cancun or the sub-tropical rainforests found just outside the cities and towns. From ancient temples to ecological wonders, Mexico is an oasis just waiting for you to explore.

A land of breathtaking landscapes, engaging culture, and rich history, Nepal is yours to experience. Through guided tours and self exploration, you'll traverse forests, discover isolated hamlets, and visit World Heritage sites. Embark on a jungle safari adventure, or just unwind with a leisurely rafting trip down the Trisuli River. Wonders never cease in the awe-inspiring land of Nepal.

From the imposing peaks of the Andes to the beauty of the Nazca desert, Peru is a country where you'll find an enthralling blend of cultures amid spectacular natural beauty. Start by exploring the Incan cities of Caral and Nazca and conclude with a memorable visit to the "Lost City of the Incas," Machu Picchu. In this, one of the world's newest Seven Wonders, you'll discover marvelous Incan ruins and scenery that will take your breath away.

By foot, plane, canoe, and train, explore the wondrous country of Peru. Embark on a spectacular trip that covers the mysterious Amazon Jungle, as well as the ancient Incan capital and World Heritage site of Cuzco. Trek to an eco-friendly jungle lodge where you'll learn from multilingual nature guides about the area's rich flora and fauna. Conclude your adventure with a memorable visit to the "Lost City of the Incas," Machu Picchu.

From awe-inspiring landscapes to heart-pounding experiences, your adventure in the American desert awaits. Hike or travel by horseback against a backdrop of spectacular scenery. Walk the paths of the Navajo Indians as you venture into the wonderland of Zion National Park and the breathtaking Bryce Canyon. Peer over the edge of the vast Grand Canyon, or try your luck in glitzy Las Vegas. Memories of a lifetime are yours for the making in the USA.

It's a fact: There's endless activity in Whistler when the snow melts. From aerial sightseeing to Ziptrekking, summertime in Whistler means nonstop outdoor recreation. Take the kids to the Adventure Zone, a mecca of fun that offers horseback rides, mini-golf, and trampolines, or head for the Westcoaster Luge, a summer sled course with banked turns and screaming straightaways. However you get your kicks, Whistler has an activity for you.

With its towering peaks, cascading waterfalls, and numerous hot springs, Banff National Park is one of Canada's most popular tourist attractions. Hike the area's many miles of trails, winding your way through old growth forests, sub-alpine valleys, or high mountain ridges. Kayak or canoe on the azure waters of Lake Louise and view the area's abundant wildlife, including elk, grizzly and black bears, moose, mountain goats, and bighorn sheep.

Mont Tremblant, located only 90 minutes from downtown Montreal, is one of the most lively and active year-round resorts in Canada - this quaint resort town is known for its many parades, concerts, and festivals. Ride the gondola to the summit of the highest peak in the Laurentians, where spectacular views await. Or simply revel in the area's many summertime activities, including mountain biking, hiking, golfing, canoeing, and swimming.

Journey to the heart of the Kootenay Rockies, where Panorama resort offers a full slate of activities. Treat the family to an unforgettable whitewater rafting trip on Toby Creek. Hike along mountain trails, fish in glacial lakes, and explore the mountainside on horseback. Cap it off with a mountain bike adventure in the Kona Bike Park, where a high-speed chairlift provides riders with access to 20 awesome trails.

Sun Peaks Resort in the heart of mountainous southern British Columbia boasts a staggering array of summertime activities; trail rides, canoe tours, and ATV adventures are just the beginning. Sign up for a bike clinic and gain valuable new skills in the Bike Park at Sun Peaks, or embark on a guided fly-fishing tour. And with 16 hiking trails and a children's sport camp, Sun Peaks delivers fun for the whole family.

Sculpted by glaciers and wind, the French Alps are one of nature's most stunning creations. The Alps are dotted with over 200 resorts - including Megeve and Val d'Isere - and summertime means pleasant weather, green valleys, and fields of wildflowers. Ride the world's highest cable car at Chamonix, hike through the region's three national parks, stroll through the lantern-lit lanes of Annency, or even learn to paraglide at Le Grand Bornand.

In the northern regions of Sweden, the Scandinavian Mountains bathe in the long light of the arctic summer. Tour the area's picturesque national parks, including Sarek, Stora SjÃ¶fallet ("Big Falls"), and Muddus. Canoe, kayak, and fish on the many lakes and rivers of this striking northland. And witness the nomadic lifestlye of the Sami, a native people who have herded reindeer here for over 12,000 years. Sweden beckons with natural beauty.

The Caribbean isn't commonly associated with mountain terrain, but the island of St. Lucia is home to a pair of striking peaks: the 2,400-foot-plus Pitons. (Climbing here is for experts only; the best views are from neighboring Mt. Gimie.) Hike through 19,000 acres of lush rainforest - prime territory for bird watchers and nature lovers. Or witness geological history at Sulphur Springs, a dormant volcano that you can actually drive a car into.

Lima is the ideal starting point for once-in-a-lifetime adventures to the legendary ruins at Macchu Picchu and the lush, Peruvian Amazon. Explore the lost city of the Incas, a UNESCO World Heritage Site recently named one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. Hike or mountain bike amid the misty peaks of the Andes, recharging your batteries at Cusco before embarking on the rest of your unforgettable journey.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Laden with glaciers, towering peaks, and flower-covered alpine valleys, the Swiss Alps are one of Europe's most scenic regions. Hike or bike the trails at Verbier, a legendary resort. Savor the alpine dusk at a summer street party in Zermatt, a mountain retreat that sits at the northern base of the Matterhorn. Or simply take a cable car up to the Klein Matterhorn, a 12,700-foot outcropping that offers staggering views of the surrounding valleys.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Laden with glaciers, towering peaks, and flower-covered alpine valleys, the Swiss Alps are one of Europe's most scenic regions. Hike or bike the trails at Verbier, a legendary resort. Savor the alpine dusk at a summer street party in Zermatt, a mountain retreat that sits at the northern base of the Matterhorn. Or simply take a cable car up to the Klein Matterhorn, a 12,700-foot outcropping that offers staggering views of the surrounding valleys.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: The Dolomites are Italy's version of the Rockies. World-class winter and summer sports - including skiing, hiking, climbing, and river rafting - make these mountains a year-round playground for both Italians and visitors. Meander through winding, wildflower-filled valleys, and tackle the trails around Falcade by mountain bike. Or learn how to rock climb at Cortina d'Ampezzo, a high mountain town that offers activities for every type of explorer.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Austria is a country of mountains - it's home to 56 peaks over 1,000 meters high. Hike through bucolic valleys beneath towering, glaciated peaks. Witness the spectacle of the Dachstein Ice Palace, an ice cave with sculptures and twisting passageways in the Dachstein Glacier. Or take a bus, car, or motorcycle across the Kaunertal Glacier Road, a stunning high alpine route connecting Austria with neighboring South Tyrol.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Lake Como has been home to Italy's upper class for centuries. Embark on a boat tour of grand lakefront villas that date back to the 1500s. Visit the Villa del Balbianello, an immaculate residence with terraced gardens and a museum dedicated to its original owner, the explorer Guido Monzino. Or simply rent a sailboat and enjoy a picnic on the shimmering waters. You'll find you feel like royalty amid Lake Como's many pleasures.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Located in the foothills of the Dolomites, Lake Maggiore is Italy's second-largest lake and one of the country's most scenic destinations. Tour the Borromean Islands, a series of rocky islets that are home to ancient palazzos, chapels, and intricate gardens filled with citrus and olive trees. Looking for peace of mind? You'll find it in cobbled alleys and waterfront cafes of Isla dei Pescatori ("Fisherman's Island"), population 50.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Whether you prefer to walk through fields of wildflowers in an alpine meadow or test the limits of your climbing skills on a guided climb of Castle Mountain, Banff and Lake Louise have adventures for you. Plunge down rollicking, glacier-fed rivers on a rafting trip, take a helicopter flightseeing tour around towering peaks, or hop on an ATV for a four-wheeled excursion. It's simple: in Banff, fun rules the day.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Toronto sits on the shore of Lake Ontario, a hub of water sports and aquatic activities, including sailing, boating, canoeing, and kayaking. Spread your towel on the picturesque white beach of Sandbanks Provincial Park, home to the world's largest freshwater sandbar and dune system. Or take to the area's 90 kilometers of paved trails - perfect terrain for walkers, runners, and cyclists. After your day in the sun, Toronto's amenities await.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Escape to Canada's largest Rocky Mountain park and explore 4,200 square miles of unspoiled sub-alpine and alpine terrain. Hike the 2-mile trail to Cavell Meadows and gaze in awe at the hanging Angel Glacier, perched on the precarious north face of Mt. Edith Cavell. Or drive the length of Icefields Parkway, a 143-mile scenic route that winds through mountains and glaciers - including the Columbia Icefield and the spectacular Crowfoot Glacier.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Niagara Falls - 188 feet high and 2,200 feet across - were first successfully descended in 1901 by a 63-year-old woman in a barrel. But you don't need to risk your life to appreciate the physics of this stunning waterfall. Listen to the earth-shaking rumble of 4 million cubic feet of water pouring over the falls every minute. And for even more drama, don't miss the spectacular fireworks show that lights up the Falls after sunset.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Auckland's fervor for sailing is legendary - the harbor is so populated with racing boats that it's nicknamed the "City of Sails." Charter a sailboat for a day and sail to Motuihe Island, the perfect spot to anchor for lunch and a swim. Taste the signature chardonnays in the winemaking district of Matakana. Or relax in the geothermal pools at the Waiwera River. However you choose to recreate, Auckland provides the perfect retreat.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: The French Alps are home to three outstanding national parks: Vanoise, Ecrins, and Mercantour. Venture to Vanoise - France's oldest national park - and hike the high alpine trails near Val d'Isere. Raft, kayak, or canoe down churning whitewater on the region's many rivers. Ride a mountain bike across the high valleys of Chamonix, or, if you're feeling especially adventurous, learn how to skydive or paraglide at La Clusaz.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: The splendidly verdant parks of Oslo make for perfect walks. Start at the riverside park at the Arkeselva River, which flows from Maridalsvannet Lake to Vaterland Park. Head to St. Hanshaugen, an urban park of tree-lined paths, streams, and cafes. Finally, explore the sculpture garden at Frogner Park, home to 212 bronze and granite sculptures made by Norway's own Gustav Vigeland. Don't forget your camera; the scenery in Oslo is incredible.

row.site: Explore the Glaciers, see the Matterhorn
row.description: Salzburg's setting is as visually remarkable as they come - the city sits on the banks of the Salzach River, nestled between the Kapuzinerberg and Monchsberg mountains. Ride a cable car to the 6,469-foot summit of the Untersberg, a nearby peak that provides dramatic mountain, city, and valley views. Or explore the many lakes, mountains, and forests of the Salzkammergut, a pastoral, unspoiled district just 10 miles east of the city.

Paris might be best known for romantic cafes and world-class museums, but the city has also made a name for itself as an amusement park mecca. Re-acquaint yourself with a familiar cast of characters at Disneyland® Resort Paris, Europe's premier amusement park. Get your roller coaster fix at Parc Asterix, home the famous Thunder of Zeus ride. Or embark on a quest for aquatic nirvana at Aquaboulevard de Paris, the largest urban water park in Europe.

Denmark's capital is home to two of the world's oldest amusement parks. Discover the Tunnel of Love and the Bakkens Hvile cabaret at Bakken Park, founded in 1583. Or bring the family to the historical grounds and classic roller coasters of Tivoli Gardens, which opened in 1843. Here, you can take a spin on the Rutsjebanen, a legendary wooden coaster built in 1914, or sail to the top of the Himmelskibet - the world's tallest carousel.

With its recent development of luxury hotels, golf courses, and upscale sports venues, Dubai has become known as the ultimate 21st century oasis. For example: Buckle your ski boots and prepare for schussing down 6,000 tons of snow at Ski Dubai, a 400-meter-tall indoor slope. Or, if you prefer water in liquid form, bring the kids to Wadi Wadi Water Park, a 12+-acre expanse of pools, water rides, and thrills that's only 20 minutes from the city center.

Dive into one of nature's greatest theme parks: The Bahamas. Float, splash, and surf your way through the slides, rivers, and rapids of Aquaventure, a kid-friendly 63-acre waterscape on Paradise Island. Swim and interact with dolphins rescued from Hurricane Katrina. Boost your heart rate on the Stuart Cove Shark Adventure - a scuba dive that puts you face-to-face with docile Caribbean reef sharks - and wind down your day with a Mai Taiâ¦on dry land, of course.

row.site: There are over 800 stores and services
row.description: Experience the West Edmonton Mall, home to more than 800 stores and services and 100 eateries. Here you'll find the world's largest indoor amusement park, with 24 rides and attractions. Whoop it up on the Mindbender - a triple-loop roller coaster - or skate like Gretzky on the NHL-size ice rink. Need to relax after all that adrenaline? Then head to the World Waterpark, a five-acre indoor waterscape that - you guessed it - is the largest in the world.

Venture to Madrid, Spain's sun-baked capital city, and experience some of the coolest amusement parks in Europe. Soar through the Spanish skies on Batman la Fuga ("Batman: the Ride") at Parque Warner Madrid, which offers a bevy of movie-themed rides. Cool off in the many pools and water rides at Aquapolis, Aqua Madrid, and Aqua Sur. Or take to the bumper boats, mini golf, and roller coasters at the kid-friendly Planeta Welby.

Hong Kong's attractions are myriad, but its amusement parks are near the top of the list. Discover the many wonders of Ocean Park, home to over 14 rides, a giant panda exhibit, and a four-story aquarium with sharks, jellyfish, and more. Pilot a Star Cruiser alongside Buzz Lightyear at Hong Kong Disneyland®, a delight for the whole family. Or launch into orbit at the Space Museum, loaded with interactive exhibits for space fans of all ages.

Montreal's theme parks run the gamut from science to silliness. Learn about the four ecosystems of North America at Biodome de Montreal, a stunning tribute to nature's beauty. Explore the aquatic ecosystems of the nearby St. Lawrence River at the Biosphere, a towering geodesic dome that houses engaging, interactive exhibits. Finally, indulge your inner goofball with a trip to La Ronde Theme Park, home to nine world-class roller coasters.

Among its many attractions, Tokyo is home to two Disney®, theme parks and two additional family fun parks. Share the excitement of Pooh's Hunny Hunt with your entire family at Tokyo Disneyland®. Journey to exotic ports of call at Tokyo DisneySea®, a nautically-themed park that's loaded with thrilling rides and coasters. Then head to Tobu Zoo Park and LaQua for more coasters, Ferris wheels, and kids' rides than you can possibly handle in a day.

Japan's second-largest city is home to Universal Studios® Japan, the only Universal theme park located outside of the United States. Visit Peter Pan's Neverland, ogle prehistoric predators in Jurassic Park, and get your thrills on the Amazing Adventures of Spider-Man ride, a state-of-the-art tribute to Spidey. Then head into the city for a ride on the 350-foot-tall HEP 5 Ferris Wheel, which sits atop a department store.

Orlando, Florida is the epicenter of family-friendly attractions. Whether you're looking to treat the kids to the latest Walt Disney World® rides or need a couples-only escape, you'll find no end of fun in the Sunshine State. Seeking thrills? Get your pulse racing with gravity-defying rides at Universal Orlando Resort®. For amazing animal encounters, don't miss SeaWorld Orlando. Need to chill? A room awaits at one of the area's luxury resorts.

Anaheim put amusement parks on the map, with the grand opening of Disneyland® Resort in 1955. If you haven't visited the home of Space Mountain and the Matterhorn in awhile, you'll be amazed at the new attractions. Take a journey to Disney's California Adventure™ park for a slew of new rides and family fun. And don't miss nearby Knott's Berry Farm and Six Flags Hurricane Harbor for kid-friendly coasters and all around good times.

row.site: Cedar Point Amusement Park, Geuaga Lake Water Park
row.description: Sandusky, Ohio is home to Cedar Point Amusement Park, where adventure seekers brave 69 of the world's most awesome rides, including 17 roller coasters. Enjoy delightful kid-friendly attractions or take on Millennium Force, a 310-foot high monster. When you're out of breath, cool off with the family at the 18-acre Soak City water park, cruise on Lake Erie, or spelunk local caverns in one of the area's many parks.

Get a taste of true Hollywood adventure in Los Angeles. Discover thrilling movie-themed rides and learn about filmmaking magic at Universal Studios® Hollywood. Ride the antique carousel at Pacific Park on a pier in Santa Monica or hit Six Flags Magic Mountain for more fun for the whole family. And don't forget that Disneyland® Resort and Knott's Berry Farm are just a short drive away.

row.site: SeaWorld San Antonio is the #1 destination theme park in Texas
row.description: For family-friendly amusement in the Lone Star state, look no farther than San Antonio. Check out some serious coasters at Six Flags Fiesta Texas, including Tony Hawk's Big Spin, which hurls riders along while spinning them 360 degrees. Encounter orcas and beluga whales and have a blast on unique rides for all ages at Sea World San Antonio. Not afraid to get wet? Ride the tubes and boogie board 'til you're soaked at Schlitterbahn Water Park.

Tampa Bay is home to some of Florida's most adventurous attractions. Don't miss Africa-themed Busch Gardens, where you'll encounter live animal exhibits, interactive shows, roller coasters, and a three-story tree house. The region's most luxurious beaches beckon families yearning for sand and surf. In search of more wildlife? Tampa Bay's two National Wildlife Refuges are teeming with manatee, pelicans, and a variety of fish.

Families flock to San Diego, where vacation memories are made at world-class attractions. The San Diego Zoo remains the zoo by which all others are measured, offering visitors encounters with rare species in their natural habitats. For bountiful fun for everyone, head to SeaWorld San Diego, Legoland California, or Knott's Soak City USA. Then take a trip to Belomont Park, where you'll find the famous "Big Dipper" wooden roller coaster.

Have an adventure steeped in history in Williamsburg, Virgina. First stop, Busch Gardens, where old-world European charm meets state of the art roller coasters and family entertainment. Splash and play at Water Country USA, where you'll find 30 all-ages attractions. Or pay a visit to the Great Wolf Lodge, a family destination designed to capture the atmosphere and adventure of the north woods.

Chicago's attractions are sure to delight the whole family. Start with Six Flags Great America; adventurous teens can test their mettle on high speed roller coasters while youngsters will enjoy family-friendly rides. Take a trip to the Shedd Aquarium to discover more than 700 species of dazzling marine animals. Then head to Lincoln Park Zoo for eye-to-eye encounters with gorillas, giraffes, and more - admission is free!

Nestled in the Smoky Mountains of Tennessee, Pigeon Forge is home to the spectacular Dollywood amusement park, named after country music legend Dolly Parton. Spend your day enjoying family-friendly theme rides and exhibits highlighting the region's history and charm. Then cool off at Dollywood's Splash Country, the water park designed for all-ages fun. Hankering for more? Don't miss encounters with prehistoric beasts at the Dinosaur Walk Museum.

The Minneapolis/St. Paul area is a big-time destination for travelers seeking amusement park fun. Start with the Mall of America, where the new Nickelodeon Universe and Underwater Adventures Aquarium turn lazy afternoons into adventures for all ages. And what about the mall's four stories of Lego displays? Cool! Then, grab your beach towels and venture to The Wisconsin Dells, appropriately known as the Water Park Capital of the World.

Tee up amid some of the West's best mountain scenery in Whistler, B.C. This outdoor-lover's getaway is best known for its world-class ski terrain, but Whistler Valley has become a premier destination for golfers of all ages and abilities. All four of Whistler's championship courses have junior tees - perfect for the entire family. Plus, kids ages 10 to 18 play for free on Whistler Village's three courses.

Puerto Vallarta's courses rank among some of Mexico's finest. Vista Vallarta, a Jack Nicklaus course, offers sweeping views of Puerto Vallarta and the ocean beyond. Head to the links at Punta Mita, the Monterey Peninsula of Mexico. (The Four Seasons Punta Mita has eight oceanfront holes, with one on an island in the Pacific.) Or choose Paradise Village's "El Tigre" course, a challenging loop with a live - and securely encaged - Bengal tiger.

Take to the lush courses of the Riviera Maya and discover why Mexico is the second most popular destination for American golfers. Play El CamaleÃ³n, a Greg Norman-designed course that hosted Mexico's first PGA Tour event in 2007. (Be prepared for the 15th hole, a seaside par 3 that plays directly toward the Caribbean.) And don't miss the remarkable Golf Club of Playacar, which incorporates over 200 Mayan ruins into its twisting, jungle-lined layout.

Bermuda may be small in size, but with nine courses on the island, it has the world's highest concentration of golf per square mile. Tee off at the Fairmont Southampton Hotel, a Theodore Robinson-designed course that features some of the largest elevation changes of any course in the world - the first two holes boast a vertical drop of more than 200 feet. Feeling rusty? Warm up at the expansive Bermuda Golf Academy's driving range and putting greens.

Start your Jamaican golf adventure at Half Moon Golf Course, a member of the Jack Nicklaus "Great Golf Resorts of the World." Designed by Robert Trent Jones, Sr., Half Moon features amenities for both beginner and advanced golfers, including undulating greens, sculpted bunkers, and multiple tee boxes. Then visit Manchester Club, the Caribbean's oldest course, or head to the Tryall Club, a demanding course that's as luxurious as they come.

Every true devotee of the game must undertake a pilgrimage to Scotland, the birthplace of golf. Grant your own wish and play a round (or three) at the Royal and Ancient Golf Club of St. Andrews, the world's most revered set of links. Venture to Carnoustie, an equally prestigious course that has hosted numerous British Open championships, or take to the links at Muirfield, another Scottish classic.

Surrey County, a lovely, pastoral district of farms and villages, is located one hour southwest of London. It's also home to over 100 well known golf courses and clubs, making it a European destination for hackers and low-handicappers alike. Start your golfing adventure at the splendid links at Abbey Moor. Then head to Worpleson Golf Club, Surrey's mix of challenging and forgiving courses designed to please golfers of all skill levels.

Escape to the rolling, emerald pastures and rocky coastlines of County Kerry, Ireland's premier golf destination. Book a tee time at the world-famous Ballybunion Golf Club, and play one of two seaside courses laden with dunes, shore grasses, and incredible views. Or choose from three courses at Killarney Golf Club, all nestled on the shores of the Killarney Lakes at the foot of Macgillycuddy Reeks, Ireland's highest mountain range.

Andalusia, Spain's southernmost region, is a golfer's paradise with top-notch courses bathed in sunshine over 300 days a year. Play your way through Marbella, the Mediterranean district that boasts such famous courses as La Quinta and Robert Trent Jones Sr.-designed Las Brisas. Continue to Costa de la Luz, where the magnificent Jack Nicklaus-designed Montecastillo Golf Club draws links enthusiasts from around the globe.

If the surf, sand, and near-constant sunshine of Los Cabos aren't enough to entertain you, hit the links at one of the area's great courses. Don't miss Palmilla, a five-star resort with 27 holes designed by Jack Nicklaus, and Cabo Real Golf Club, with oceanview holes that entice experts and beginners alike. Look out for the pros: Cabo has hosted the Senior Slam tourney for many years, attracting golf greats such as Raymond Floyd and Hale Irwin.

row.site: Home to more than 200 golf courses.
row.description: There's a reason the National Golf Foundation named Greater Phoenix the "Golf Capitol of the World." Start with over 200 courses set amid the red rock bluffs and saguaro cacti. Be sure to visit the courses designed by the pros - Robert Trent Jones, Jack Nicklaus, and Arnold Palmer all have fairways here. What's more, you'll enjoy your day (or week, or why not make it a month?) of golf with all the amenities of luxurious spa resorts.

row.site: Home to more than 200 golf courses.
row.description: Wherever you tee up on Oahu, you're surrounded by breathtaking tropical scenery. Take your pick of more than forty public and private courses, from casual municipal links to luxurious resorts with all the amenities. Hit fairways on bluffs with the Pacific Ocean crashing on rocks below. Oahu offers more courses than any other Hawaiian island, making it a true golfer's paradise. It's many other kinds of paradise, too.

row.site: Home to more than 200 golf courses.
row.description: Try your hardest to keep your eye on the ball when you're golfing on Maui. Here you'll enjoy fairways abutting ancient lava floes, palm groves, and rainbows in the ocean mist. Tee up at any of 16 courses, many of them ranked at or near the top of "world's best" lists. After all, this is the island where the PGA Tour's Mercedes Benz Championship is held every year, luring the pros to one of earth's most breathtaking settings.

row.site: 176 golf courses within an hour's drive of Orlando.
row.description: Tired of checking the weather report every time you want to hit the fairway? Journey to Orlando, where the sun shines 300 days of year on 176 courses within an hour of the city. Over twenty golf academies make this a serious town for links, and all the attention to design and natural beauty is apparent in every sculpted green. And why not take in some of the area's famous attractions - from theme parks to beaches - on your off day?

row.site: Palm Beach County is known as Florida's Golf Capital
row.description: Over 160 courses greet visitors to Palm Beach, known as Florida's Golf Capital. Hit the links at some of the country's oldest courses, even the one where the classic comedy Caddyshack was filmed. Work on improving your handicap among sand traps and water features designed to complement the natural beauty of one of America's most lush regions. Venture to Palm Beach to play in the shadows of the greats.

Myrtle Beach, South Carolina offers links enthusiasts more than a hundred of the country's highest rated courses. Affordable gems and elegant greens designed by the likes of Arnold Palmer, Reese Jones, and Dan Maples greet golfers looking to improve their game. Enjoy some laid back, lemonade-sipping golf at courses nestled amid mossy oaks. Bringing the kids along? Make memories at any of the area's 46 fun-themed kids' courses.

Nestled on the Caloosahatchee River, Ft. Myers, Florida was the vacation getaway of Henry Ford and Thomas Edison. But you don't have to be a wealthy industrialist to enjoy the area's wealth of courses. Improve your game at any number of courses geared toward the average golfer, or tee up on links worthy of the pros. After some quality time with your nine iron, kick back at one of many superb eateries on the downtown waterfront.

row.site: Recently rated the nation's number 1 golf city by CNN.com
row.description: Offering 51 public courses within a 30-mile radius, Austin, Texas welcomes golfers of all skill levels. Try out your new putter on one of four nationally ranked championship courses at Barton Creek Resort and Spa. Reserve your tee time at the popular Lions Municipal Golf Course, a set of public greens rich in history. Whatever your handicap, you'll see why CNN rated Austin the nation's #1 golf city.

For sheer beauty and an abundance of challenging courses, Palm Springs raises the bar. Perfect your swing with the San Jacinto Mountains as your backdrop at the spectacular Cathedral Canyon Country Club. See for yourself why Cimarron Golf Resort was chosen as one of Golf Digest's Best Places to Play. And don't miss the affordable Indian Springs Country Club, which was a hit within the first year it opened. Palm Springs means serious golf.
Try out Torrey Pines - The prestigious 2008 U.S. Open will be held at the internationally renowned Torrey Pines Golf Course.

Home to both the famous Pebble Beach Golf Links and the oldest course west of the Mississippi, Monterey, California offers golfers a combined 471 holes at 20 public and private courses. Plan your golf adventure around a trip up scenic Highway 68 to the courses of sun-drenched Carmel Valley. You'll tee off amid the splendor of California's sea-splashed coastline and find out why avid golfers make pilgrimages to this land of fair weather fairways.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Book a spa treatment and give your body a much-needed rest from Whistler's nonstop skiing, hiking, biking, and golfing. This mega-resort town boasts more than 20 spas offering everything from Moor Mud wraps to Ayurvedic facials. Treat your toes to a pedicure while a stylist works magic on your hair. And gentlemen, listen up: many spas in Whistler offer special rates for couples, making a shiatsu massage for two the perfect surprise gift.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: While many travelers flock to Banff and Lake Louise for the multitude of outdoor activities, a growing number of visitors love the area for its spas, salons, and hot springs. Indulge yourself with a Vichy hydrotherapy treatment or a full body Swedish massage session. Or take the whole family to one of Banff's hot springs complexes, both of which have thermal pools, swimming pools, cafes, and children's play areas.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: The Bahamas are home to some of the world's most exclusive spas, including the five-star One & Only Ocean Club, where you can enjoy a heated seaweed mask followed by a massage. Book a stay for two at the Sandals Royal Bahamian Resort & Spa, a couples-only escape with eucalyptus steam baths and hot and cold plunge pools. You'll find pampering the top priority at every resort on this tropical isle.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Thanks to boutique resorts like the Sivory Punta Cana - a beachfront enclave with Balinese suites and three top-tier restaurants - the Dominican Republic is quickly becoming known as a luxury destination. Enjoy a beachfront shiatsu massage at an all-inclusive resort and spa, or book a hot volcanic stone massage at Puerto Plata's new Maxim Bungalow, which also offers caviar facials. Luxury is no stranger to this island paradise.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: St. Lucia is an island of sublime luxury resorts. Lounge beside your cabana and private infinity pool at Jade Mountain resort, which overlooks the Pitons and the Caribbean. Unwind in the luxurious isolation of Anse Chastanet, a 600-acre resort with private cabanas and a beachfront spa offering Swedish massage and aromatherapy. Whether you prefer air conditioning or fresh air, St. Lucia has a luxurious retreat for you.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Jamaica is resplendent with a variety of high-end spas and resorts, including Goldeneye, the 18-acre luxury resort that was once the estate of James Bond author Ian Fleming. Discover the remarkable Caves resort, an oceanfront escape with sea caves, grottos, and ten private cottages. Or treat your family to hot stone massages, Frette linens, and butler service at the Ritz Carlton Rose Hall, a five-star resort set on 5,000 acres.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Cancún's resorts and spas rank among the finest in the world. Proof: the JW Marriott Cancún was rated one of the world's top 50 resort spas by Conde Nast. Immerse yourself in a cascading waterfall massage at Le Meridien Cancún, a French-themed spa with private pools and Swiss showers. Traveling as a twosome? Treat your significant other to a private outdoor massage suite at the Le Blanc Spa, where shiatsu, Thai, and Swedish massage experts await.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Slip away to Los Cabos, home of Mexico's most posh spas and hotels. Splurge on an algae body wrap at Las Ventanas Al Paraiso, Cabo's most luxurious retreat. Receive an innovative wine- and grape-infused skin treatment at the SOMMA Wine Spa. And stay in boutique heaven at the Casa del Mar beach resort, home to a silent sunbathing area and nightly holistic meditation rituals around a beach fire. When luxury calls, Los Cabos answers.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: The Pacific coastline north of Puerto Vallarta is home to a wealth of upscale resorts - so many, in fact, that it's known as the "Mexican Riviera." Revel in an exfoliating chamomile body scrub at the Apuane Spa, located in the Four Seasons Punta Mita. Or relax beside the sprawling pool complex at Grand Velas, a five-star resort with an on-site spa that offers a hot and cold lagoon, Swiss showers, and a full massage menu.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Barbados is a heavenly getaway for romantics, single travelers, and families alike. Bring your clubs to Sandy Lane Resort, where the golf courses and spa are equally renowned. Relax with the family beside the expansive, multi-tiered pool complex at the historical Crane Resort, built in 1887. But bring only your spouse to The House, a four-star, adults-only resort where each couple is assigned a personal ambassador.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Paris's history is as rich as its cuisine. Experience the towering nave and flying buttresses of Notre Dame de Paris cathedral, one of the grandest buildings in Europe. Savor the views of Paris from the observation deck of the Eiffel Tower, perhaps the world's most recognizable structure. Art aficionados, head for the Monet and Renoir collections at the Musee d'Orsay and don't forget to trade a smile with Mona Lisa at the Louvre.

row.site: Birthplace of independence: Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, Betsy Ross House.
row.description: Begin your tour of Rome's historical attractions with a visit to Vatican City and St. Peter's Basilica, a place of pilgrimage for Catholics from around the globe. Witness the spectacle that is the Roman Coliseum, built in 70 AD, and the towering columns of the Pantheon (built 125 AD). Then toss a coin into the famous Trevi Fountain and continue to the Musei Vaticani, a series of Vatican museums that includes the world-renowned Sistine Chapel.

Jerusalem is one of the world's holiest cities; its unique history, spiritual significance, and cultural palette make it an exceptional destination. Explore the Old City - the historical city center that's divided into the Armenian, Jewish, Christian, and Muslim Quarters. View legendary religious sites, including Temple Mount and the Western Wall. Or simply stroll the narrow streets lined with savory food stalls and craft shops.

The gorgeous city of Florence, capital of Tuscany and birthplace of the Italian Renaissance, beckons the learned and curious. Discover the majesty of David, one of Michelangelo's most famous statues. Admire the famed Cupola del Duomo, a domed structure atop the Basilica di Santa Maria di Fiore, built in 1436. Or spend an afternoon in the presence of seminal works of the Renaissance in the many galleries at Galleria dell'Accademia.

London's cultural resume ranks among the best in the world. (It is, after all, the city that gave birth to the English Renaissance, the Industrial Revolution, and the Gothic Revival.) For starters, visit London's four UNESCO World Heritage Sites: the Palace of Westminster, the Tower of London, the historical settlement of Greenwich, and the Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew. Or discover the modern charms of Fleet Street, West End, or Hyde Park.

Surrounded by a treasure trove of Mayan ruins and historical sites, Cancún sits at the intersection of modernity and history. Take a day trip to the awe-inspiring ruins at Chichen Itza before returning to your posh beachfront hotel. Venture further afield to Chetumal, where the Museum of Mayan Culture awaits. Or stay in town and visit the Casa de la Cultura Museum, home to native artworks, traditional dances, theater events, and music performances.

Founded more than 3,000 years ago, Athens is one of the world's oldest cities. Journey to the Acropolis, where collections of artifacts from the Temple of Athena, the Parthenon, and the Theatre of Dionysus await. Visit the awe-inspiring Ancient Agora of Athens, a temple dedicated to the Greek gods built in the 5th century. Or discover the Benaki Museum, a downtown institution that houses a vast range of Greek art, from prehistoric to modern.

Travel to the heart of China's rich cultural traditions: Beijing.
