Experience the grandeur of the Great Wall, the 4,000-mile fortification that defined the northern boundary of successive Chinese dynasties. Marvel at the intricate palaces, guard towers, and gates of Beijing's Forbidden City, built in 1420. And don't miss Tiananmen Square, the sprawling central plaza that has been the site of some of China's most significant cultural uprisings.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: The world's only metropolis situated on two continents, Istanbul straddles the Bosphorous Strait, that divides Europe and Asia. Discover the wonders of this unique cultural blend. Start at the ornate courtyards of the Topkapi Palace and explore the Underground Cistern, a sprawling cavern filled with Roman arches, columns, and shimmering waters. Or witness the massive, Byzantine dome of the Hagia Sophia museum, built in the 8th century.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Lima is often known as the first stop on the journey to the miraculous ruins at Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world. But the city has plenty of attractions within its borders - start with the Cercado de Lima, the historical central district that's a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore the neighborhood's colonial architecture or haggle with artisans who set up shop along winding streets that are themselves a feast for the senses.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Ornate and steeped in history, Prague is one of Europe's most gorgeous cities. Visit the massive Prague Castle - the world's largest ancient castle - and walk the narrow, shop-lined streets of the Old Town before crossing the 15th century Charles Bridge. Peruse the Strahov Monastery, a museum and library built in 1120, and syncronize your watch to the Prague Astronomical Clock, a medieval timepiece mounted on a tower in the Old Town.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Quebec, Canada's second-oldest existing European settlement, celebrates its 400th anniversary in 2008. Explore the massive stone ramparts and battlements in the Old City - the oldest still-standing fortifications north of Mexico. Visit the endlessly engaging Musee de la Civilisation, home to interactive exhibits on Canadian history and humanities. And drop in on the grand Chateau Frontenac hotel for exquisitely-presented afternoon tea.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: For an energetic introduction to Southeast Asian culture, venture to Bangkok, the bustling capital of Thailand. Tour the Wat Arun ("Temple of the Dawn"), a towering Buddhist temple that features an unmistakable central spire. Meander through the manicured grounds and gold-plated spires of the Grand Palace, home to Thai kings until the mid-20th century. Or take a day tour to the historic ruins of Ayudhaya, this vibrant country's former capital.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: There's no better place to explore America's past than Boston. Start with a walk on the Freedom Trail past sites of epic Revolutionary War struggles. Visit the city's oldest residence - Paul Revere's 1680 home and the site where his midnight ride began. Looking for a more contemporary experience? The museums in Boston are an embarrassment of riches; don't miss the Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Children's Museum, and New England Aquarium.

row.site: Birthplace of independence: Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, Betsy Ross House.
row.description: The birthplace of independence provides ample chances to discover American history. Explore Philadelphia's many historical landmarks, including Independence Hall, Betsy Ross's house, and the iconic Liberty Bell. Spend the day absorbing art and history in the city's superb museums, including the Philadelphia Museum of Art and the Franklin Institute. Love architecture? Don't miss the marvelous Society Hill and Rittenhouse Square neighborhoods.

Washington, D.C. is monumental in every sense of the word. Embark on a quest to the nation's capital and experience the grandeur of the Washington Monument and the solemnity of the Vietnam Memorial, all a stone's throw from the halls of power. Watch democracy in action in the U.S. Capitol Building, marvel at the Smithsonian's free exhibits, and spend the afternoon among the stacks in the Library of Congress. This is the city where history is made.

Williamsburg, Virginia astounds visitors with its hands-on approach to history. Kids love to learn at Colonial Williamsburg, the amusement park where America's founding comes to life. Walk in the footsteps of the nation's earliest scholars at William and Mary, the country's second oldest college. Have a passion for military history? You can stand in the very place where George Washington defeated General Cornwallis in Yorktown.

Nashville, Tennessee is rightly famous as America's mecca for country music. Step into the Grand Ole Opry and catch today's rising stars as well as the giants of country music's recent past. Then saunter on over to the Ryman Auditorium and the Country Music Hall of Fame for more music and artifacts. It's not all about the music, though. Civil War buffs will love exploring the historical site of the Battle of Nashville.

Remember the Alamo when you're thinking of a cultural adventure. San Antonio is the site of the famous fort, but there's much more to see in this city deep in the heart of Texas. Spend an afternoon among the San Antonio Missions, the largest concentration of missions in North America. Hop over to La Vita Historical Arts Village, the city's oldest neighborhood, now an artists' enclave. This is a city where you can get happily lost in history.

Life moves at a more leisurely pace in genteel Savannah. Explore Georgia's first city, where more than 45 elegant inns and B&Bs define southern hospitality. If you're inspired by beautiful buildings, you'll want to head straight for the city's historical district, where you'll see eight distinct architectural styles on grand display. Or venture to the Wormsloe plantation or the stately Mercer House for a glimpse of true southern style.

One of America's best-preserved cities, Charleston, South Carolina exudes historical charm. Journey down cobblestone streets past grand mansions, magnificent churches, and lush gardens, all meticulously maintained. Explore the history of the Old South with plantation tours or visits to numerous museums dedicated to the Civil War. Once you've been steeped in heritage, downtown Charleston offers fine southern dining for the hungry history buff.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Mackinac Island is one of Michigan's most charming Victorian escapes. Here, motorized vehicles of any kind are banned, so you'll explore this relaxing landscape by horse drawn carriage or tandem bike. Discover the fascinating artifacts of Native, military, and missionary cultures who have called the island home. Or, marvel at either of two butterfly attractions, just examples of the many natural wonders you'll encounter at this island getaway.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Stunning Native American art meets Spanish architecture in Santa Fe, North America's oldest capital city. Start at the plaza, the city's cultural hub. Get your creative juices flowing with visits to the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum and the Museum of International Folk Art. Looking for history as well as art? Step back into the 19th-century at the meticulously presented Rancho de las Golondrinas or the elegant Palace of the Governors.

If you want to experience the legendary beaches, ruins, and nightlife of Mexico, then escape to Cancún. Discover the awe-inspiring intelligence of dolphins during a safe, intimate swim with these fascinating marine mammals. Or simply indulge yourself with a beachside massage at one of Cancún's many all-inclusive four- and five-star resorts, where stress disappears as quickly as you can order your next poolside beverage.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum).
row.description: Journey to the sun-soaked heart of the Yucatan Peninsula, where you'll enjoy easy access to the Mayan ruins of Chichen It'za and Tulum. Escape to the eco-conscious Xcaret Eco Theme Park for an inspiring adventure composed of equal parts conservation, Mayan culture, and snorkeling. Then recharge your batteries on the area's vast, unspoiled beaches and all-inclusive resorts. However you choose to worship the sun, Riviera Maya is your temple.

row.site: Museums (Museum of Fine Arts, Science Museum, Aquarium, Childrens Museum
row.description: Located on the island of Hispaniola, the Dominican Republic is home to the Caribbean's highest mountain, Pico Duarte. With some of the best hiking trails in the region, you can easily explore the lush scenery on foot. Or by boat - check out over 800 miles of pristine beaches and vibrant coral reefs. But the DR isn't all charmingly rustic; the country has a host of all-inclusive resorts specializing in pampering the most discerning luxury traveler.

Venture to the idyllic, sugar-sand beaches and verdant jungles of Jamaica, the birthplace of the all-inclusive resort. Explore the underwater shipwrecks, reefs, and rock formations that make this Caribbean island a premier diving and snorkeling destination. Glide through the forest canopy on a zip line tour, or sip a mango-infused cocktail under a thatched umbrella at a spa resort. Whatever your pleasure, Jamaica is the place to unwind.

Looking for an artsy, natural escape from the rigors of everyday life? Consider Puerto Vallarta, renowned for its resident artists and potters, chic boutiques, and bustling music venues. Get an adrenaline fix in the nearby Sierra Madre Mountains, where canopy tours, jeep safaris, and canyoneering adventures await. Then complete your coastal getaway with a whale-watching cruise; gray whales are common here from January through late spring.

Commune with the Pacific Ocean at Los Cabos, a beach destination that offers equal servings of adventure (including sport fishing, whale-watching, and surfing) and relaxation (thanks to beachfront spa treatments, glorious nightly sunsets, and an excellent dining scene). Expand your knowledge of the local environment with an ecotour - by kayak, sailboat, or simply a stroll on the beach. However you define bliss, you'll achieve it in Los Cabos.

Voyage to St. Lucia, the Caribbean's hidden gem. Discover the island's 19,000 acres of lush rainforest, home to the Mangrove Cuckoo and the St. Lucian Parrot. Bicycle through gentle forest paths or paddle a sea kayak along the base of the breathtaking Pitons, a pair of peaks that rise more than 2,400 feet above the ocean. Or rejuvenate your mind and body with a Caribbean sea wrap at one of St. Lucia's renowned luxury resorts.

If it's beaches you seek - glorious, sunny, life-giving beaches - look no further than Antigua. This Caribbean hotspot has 365 of them - one for each day of the year. Relax in an oceanfront villa (with butler service, of course) at one of Antigua's all-inclusive resorts. Or mingle with the nautical set on the piers of this sailing-obsessed isle. After you've experienced Antigua's hospitality and luminous natural beauty, you'll want to stay year-round.

Immerse yourself in the crystalline waters, expansive coral reefs, and pristine beaches of Cozumel, one of the world's top diving destinations. Snorkel, dine, and sunbathe the day away at Chankanaab Park, a sheltered lagoon with snorkel-friendly reefs, a botanical garden, and beachfront cantinas. Or, if it's pure relaxation that you're after, enjoy a hot stone massage or poolside cocktail at one of the island's many all-inclusive resorts.

row.site: Tour the island on a tandem bicycle.
row.description: Venture to the lush mountains and endless beaches of Costa Rica, the birthplace of the ecotourism movement. Discover the country's spectacular biodiversity, including howler monkeys, toucans, and humpback whales. Thanks to Costa Rica's varied topography and small size, you can take a canopy tour in a cloud forest, climb the flanks of an active volcano, and enjoy a Pacific Ocean sunset on a stunning beach - all in the same day.

The snow-capped Rocky Mountains set the stage for outdoor adventures in Boise, Idaho. Explore 2,600 acres of natural beauty any time of year at Bogus Basin Ski Resort. If ATVs and dirt bikes get your motor running, you'll have plenty of muddy trails to rip through. Or rent a kayak and spend the day on the Boise River. Whether it's biking, hiking, or just breathing fresh mountain air, you'll find plenty to do in this Southwest Idaho escape.

Four mountains. Two scenic towns. Welcome to Aspen and Snowmass! Pack a picnic lunch and hike to fields of wildflowers. Hop on a horse or mountain bike and trek on trails winding through untouched wilderness. Traveling with kids? They'll squeal with delight playing on the Eurobungy trampoline. But before you leave these charming alpine towns, don't forget to take a nature walk guided by one of the area's resident experts.

Vail is the nation's hippest resort town and a magnet for celebrities looking for a little R&R. It's not hard to see why, with golf, horseback riding, rock climbing, and kayaking being just a few of the ways visitors can enjoy the splendor of this magnificent mountain town. Grab a gondola to Vail Mountain's Adventure Ridge or take the kids up in a balloon ride. Then take to the trails on your bike. At days end, Vail offers exciting nightlife.

Oregon's Bend and Sunriver are perfect places to experience the splendor of the Cascade Mountain range. Hit nearly 40 miles of paved bike and walking paths, or dip your paddle into the glasslike surface of a serene mountain lake. Don't worry if you left your horse at home - stables staffed with friendly guides will meet your equestrian needs. Outdoor fun for the whole family awaits in these charming mountain towns.

They don't call it Big Sky for nothing. The sweeping vistas of this Montana getaway are enough to make even the most seasoned outdoors enthusiast swoon. Take the year-round ski lift up Lone Mountain to a tangled network of trails. Marvel at miles of back country scenery by mountain bike or bring your rod and reel for some of Montana's famous fly-fishing. Whether you're looking for biking or bison, Big Sky provides adventure in a big way.

Lush forests, deep canyons, and North America's saltiest lake lure outdoor adventurers to - where else? - Salt Lake City. Use the city as your base camp for excursions by horseback, mountain bike, or your trusty pair of boots. Explore parks just minutes from the city center or soar above it all in a hot air balloon. For climbing, you can't go wrong in the grand Wasatch Mountains. This site of the winter Olympics guarantees great memories.

Four seasons a year, Stowe, Vermont means serious outdoor recreation, especially if you're a trail lover. Panoramic views reward your efforts as you hike scenic Mount Mansfield. Enjoy the greenery in over 3,000 acres of wilds preserved by the Stowe Land Trust. Warm weather visitors often spend one day hiking the winding trails and the next unwinding in the more than 50 hotels and resorts, 50 restaurants, and 70 unique boutique and specialty shops.

Sun Valley's Bald Mountain is sort of a misnomer - this outdoor getaway is covered with fields of wildflowers. Wear out your boots on 28 miles of trails on "Baldy" for sure, but don't miss Silver Creek, where you can try your hand at fly-fishing. Ride the rapids on Salmon River or tee off at award-winning golf courses. There's even a skate park for teens (or really cool adults). As a gorgeous summer getaway, Sun Valley is aptly named.

Pennsylvania's Poconos deliver a great value for the adventure-bound traveler. Take your pick of 150 lakes, including gorgeous Lake Wallenpaupack, for endless water-borne recreation. Lace up your boots for some back country nature walking or gaze up at the stars as you roast marshmallows in a remote camp site. Tired of roughing it? Just check into one of the area's luxury resorts or B&Bs, situated mere feet from your next excursion.

America's most visited (and arguably most beautiful) national park, Great Smoky Mountains National Park spans some 800 square miles of protected forest along the border of North Carolina and Tennessee. Establish your base in friendly Gatlinburg, then explore the park's hundreds of trails by foot or horseback. From waterfalls to mountain peaks, the area's natural wonders guarantee repeat visits.

There's a reason why they don't call it "the sort of impressive canyon." Sedona, Arizona is the ideal spot to comprehend the scope and majesty of one of America's natural wonders. Start at Grand Canyon National Park where you can take it in at Pipe Creek Vista and Yavapai Point. Venture into relaxed Sedona, your base camp for treks among red rock monoliths named Coffeepot, Snoopy, and Cathedral. Here's where nature puts on a spectacular show.

row.site: Yosemite Falls is the world's 5th tallest waterfall
row.description: You've seen the Ansel Adams photographs, now experience Yosemite in full color. Trek by car or foot through this setting of peace and beauty formed by the violence of earthquakes and glaciers. Stargaze, kayak, fish, or cling to a sheer rock face. And be sure to experience the grandeur of Yosemite Falls, the world's 5th tallest waterfall. For families looking to escape to nature or couples looking for romance, Yosemite's beauty stirs the soul.

America's oldest national park, Yellowstone is still one of the best. Marvel at the world's most extraordinary geysers, hot springs, and geological wonders. Catch a glimpse of abundant native wildlife, including grizzlies, wolves, bison, and elk. Take a dip in a 50-yard-long band of thermal soaking pools along the Gardner River. Finally, make your trip truly memorable by visiting the majestic Grand Canyon of Yellowstone.

Rising dramatically above placid alpine lakes, Wyoming's Grand Tetons lure travelers looking for rugged adventure or peaceful escape. Set up camp in Jackson, either at a campsite or an elegant yet rustic spa resort. Then take in the wonders of one of the world's most recognizable mountain landscapes by hiking or biking verdant trails. Bonus points for spotting celebrities - Jackson Hole valley is the weekend retreat for a number of famous faces.

Think of skiing when you think of Lake Tahoe? Think again. This warm-weather getaway boasts 191 square miles of sparkling blue water ideal for summer recreation. Sail, hike, bike, or paddleboat, or head into town for an adventure in shopping and fine dining. Catch one of the area's legendary summer events - the Tahoe Shakespeare Festival, perchance? One of America's most beautiful places offers families and couples countless outdoor memories.

There are so many attractions in Wisconsin's The Dells that it'll take more than one trip to experience them all. Kids will love getting soaked at the area's famous water parks - bring your trunks and see why The Dells is called the water park capital of the world. Travel by horse-drawn carriage through the magnificent cliff-walled gorges of Lost Canyon. Or take a drive then a dip into picturesque lakes on one of many amphibious vehicle tours.

Glacier, Montana is a hiker's paradise with over 700 miles of trails, from scenic and leisurely to rugged and exhausting. Savor the solitude of a deep wilderness excursion or pack a picnic and take in the vistas in a flower-covered alpine meadow. Stop in nearby Whitefish for horseback rides and a stay in one of the town's many welcoming inns. When you travel to this beautiful part of Montana, be sure to bring your sense of wonder.

With 205 parks in city limits and 20,000 acres of parks in the nearby mountains, the most difficult decision facing visitors to Denver, Colorado is whether to take in the scenery by bike or hiking boots. You don't even have to leave city limits to enjoy mountain biking - Denver cyclists brag about their 850 miles of paved, off-road trails. Want to experience the South Platte River? Do it with gusto on 17 miles of kayak chutes.

The Tuscany-like countryside surrounding Traverse City produces grapes, meaning this Michigan locale is the heart of Midwestern wine country. After you've taken in the bucolic charms of the vineyards, head to over 180 miles of Lake Michigan shoreline for some sailing or sunbathing. Seeking more fun? Upscale golf courses and a historic downtown lined with shops make this an unforgettable getaway.

You might know Austin, Texas for its abundant music and arts scene, but take a look at its natural wonders. Start with 785-foot Mount Bonnell, one of the city's most enduring attractions. Enjoy miles of trails in picnic-friendly McKinney Falls State Park, named after the spectacular waterfalls gracing its 635 acres. Then watch expert climbers defy gravity as they scale Enchanted Rock, rising high above the ruggedly beautiful landscape.

Rekindle your romance in Tuscany, a region of central Italy rich with stunning, rural landscapes and vibrant artistic traditions. Bike through the vineyards and rolling hills of the Tuscan countryside, stopping for a sip at village cafes and wineries. Stroll the twisting streets of Florence, home of the Italian Renaissance, taking in art at the city's many galleries. Then cap the day at a candlelit table for two at a neighborhood bistro.

row.site: Tour the Eiffel tower at sunset.
row.description: There is no better destination for a romantic getaway than Paris. Tour the Eiffel Tower at sunset and watch the city come to life below. Pack a bottle of Bordeaux and a baguette for a picnic at the Château de Versaille, a 17th-century palace outside the city. Stroll the banks of the Seine, site of countless love scenes, both cinematic and genuine. And remember to walk the Champs Elysees, where lovely sidewalk cafes and local characters abound.

Venice is the city of canals, bridges, and serious romance. Climb aboard a gondola - those iconic vessels of Venetian lore - and take a ride down the Grand Canal. Relax at a canal-front café with a bottle of Chianti as musicians serendade from the water, or enjoy a leisurely stroll through cobbled alleys to the beautiful Bridge of Sighs. Finish your day with tiramisu and champagne at one of the city's many fine gourmet restaurants.

Thanks to its many luxurious, couples-only resorts, the Riviera Maya has carved out a niche as a honeymooner's paradise. Treat yourselves to a champagne breakfast in bed, rose petals in your room, or a candlelit dinner in the shallows of a secluded pool. If you can imagine it, these resorts can make it happen. Should you find yourself newly engaged, you'll have no trouble planning the wedding: many properties offer wedding packages.

Re-discover romance on the cobblestone streets of Old Montreal - the historical city center that's loaded with museums, shops, and restaurants. Embark on a 90-minute tour of the waterfront aboard the Parisian-style Bateau-Mouche, with views from La Ronde to the Olympic Stadium. Or take a romantic picnic to the Parc de la Promenade Bellerive, a 22-acre park on the banks of the St. Lawrence River.

What is it about falling water that makes us fall in love? It's hard to say, but one thing is clear: Niagara Falls is a honeymooner's paradise. Today couples seeking a great value pick Niagara after they've tied the knot. Get up close to this cascading natural wonder by boat and enjoy a romantic evening light and fireworks show. And be sure to savor the offerings of area's many excellent restaurants and spas.

destinations.row: Europe Vienna Austria Capital of the Austro-Hungarian empire. Romance echoes through Vienna's historical Innere Stadt. At sunset, stroll the Stephansplatz - the city's central square - and watch as the towering cathedral comes alive with lights. Score a table at the renowned Osterreicher Im Mak and linger over a Viennese meal of savory goulash, bread dumplings, and a bottle of Riesling. Looking for entertainment? Top off the evening at a performance of the Vienna State Opera, one of the world's finest. http://media.expedia.com/media/content/expus/graphics/storefronts/ski/dest_winterpark_124x89.gifv

row.description: Golden Mediterranean sunshine bathes the city of Nice, the unofficial capital of the Riviera. Spend a morning cycling through lavender fields outside the city. For lunch, break out a blanket, some brie, a baguette, and wine on the beach, then take an afternoon stroll down the cobbled streets of Old Town. Afterward, explore nearby Colline du Château ("Castle Hill"), a treasured park with fig trees and breathtaking views of the city below.

Whatever your definition of romance, Bali has a setting for you. Go glitzy with a private beachfront villa at a luxury resort, where you'll dine at a candlelit table in the sand. If local culture is a priority, head to an elite hideaway in the mountain village of Ubud, an active hub of Balinese artisans. Or escape to the island's isolated southern beaches, where the crowds are appreciably smaller.

Acapulco's mix of high-end resorts and budget lodging make it an excellent choice for romantics from any tax bracket. Rekindle the fire at Las Brisas, with hilltop casitas, private plunge pools, and beachfront dining. Walk the shores of Acapulco Bay at sunset before ordering the fresh lobster at one of the city's finest restaurants. For a more affordable yet equally romantic getaway, hit up the oceanfront grills and palapas to the north of town.

Of the 332 islands that comprise the nation of Fiji, only 110 are inhabited. The country has a wealth of unspoiled tropical beaches, reefs, and islets. Island-hop in the exceptional Yasawa Group, a 12-island archipelago that's home to budget digs (i.e. thatched huts) and premier resorts (i.e. private cabanas with air conditioning and butler service). The islands are also have their share of adults-only resorts, all the better for a party of two.

The stunning Society Islands are the beating heart of French Polynesian culture and history. Here you'll discover the impossibly picturesque islands of Bora Bora and Tahiti. Snorkel in Bora Bora's crystal clear lagoon, picnic on a pristine white sand beach, or dine on authentic French cuisine at the elegant Villa Mahana. For dessert, simply stroll Le Marche - Tahiti's bustling market - while snacking on crÃªpes from a street cart.

Savannah, Georgia's classic Southern architecture, leafy boulevards, and cobblestone parks provide lucky visitors with an endlessly charming romantic backdrop. Stroll through meticulously maintained gardens in the city's Landmark Historical District. Explore galleries overflowing with the work of talented local artists, and dine at fine establishments where the waiter quickly becomes your new best friend. Savannah is a city to fall in love with.

Famous for streetcars, fine cuisine, and charming boutique hotels, San Francisco is the romantic getaway of choice for those in love with beautiful cities. Experience the beauty of the Bay at Golden Gate Park. Explore crooked Lombard Street or North Beach cafes where poets moved their generations. Start the evening together by taking in the sunset from Twin Peaks or Coit Tower on Telegraph Hill. Let the City by the Bay take your breath away.

row.site: Dinner, sights from atop the Space Needle.
row.description: From the iconic Space Needle where diners marvel at mountain views, to the galleries and shops of historical Pioneer Square, Seattle, Washington welcomes visitors with an array of romantic enclaves. Take a sunset cruise on Elliott Bay or stroll among flowers and fruit at Pike Place Market. Whether you explore museums, fine dining, entertainment, or all the above, your visit to Seattle promises to be sleepless and memorable.

row.site: Wine tasting at local vineyards, fine dining, spa.
row.description: Newport, Rhode Island was the vacation playground of choice for Gilded Age aristocrats, who constructed opulent mansions along the shore. Many of these manses are open to the public, welcoming travelers smitten with the romance of the past. Rent a sailboat for an afternoon, or luxuriate with a trip for two to the spa. At day's end, curl up with a glass of local wine at any of the town's premier dining destinations.

row.site: Guided River Cruise on the Napa River.
row.description: Wine is only the beginning of a romantic getaway to Napa Valley. Enjoy a guided cruise on the Napa River, where local personalities help you spot wildlife along the banks while you enjoy a bottle of vino. Pack up your picnic and wind through the countryside by bicycle. With an abundance of spas, some of the finest dining this side of paradise, and gorgeous scenery, Napa Valley is a place where love blooms among the vines.

row.site: Guided River Cruise on the Napa River.
row.description: What's not to love about New York? The city of Woody Allen's romantic comedies, world-famous parks, and dining to die for makes romance not only possible, but inevitable. Start with a carriage ride around Central Park and stop off at any of the astounding museums that ring its perimeter. Bop along in a jazz club or experience the grandeur of the latest operatic masterpiece. Don't just enjoy a night out on the town, enjoy a night out on the town.

row.site: St. Augustine is the nations oldest city filled with historic architecture.
row.description: Explore the romance and beauty of America's oldest city, St. Augustine, Florida. Here you can tour the historical architecture from the comfort of trains, trolleys, or a horse-drawn carriage. Indulge in some retail therapy among many fine arts and crafts shops and savor an intimate fine dining experience. Conquistadors believed this to be the site of the Fountain of Youth, and after your refreshing visit, you may be inclined to agree.

row.site: St. Croix is the largest of the United States Virgin Islands.
row.description: A typical romantic night out for natives of the U.S. Virgin Islands includes a moon-lit walk on beach, a dinner of seafood caught just that afternoon, and cocktails quaffed to the beat of Calypso drummers. Why not go local? Explore secluded St. John, two-thirds of which is a lush national park. Stroll among the mills and sugarcane plantations of St. Croix. Or take a day trip by ferry to St. Thomas's pristine beaches. You won't want to leave...

row.site: Best resort spas in the country.
row.description: Some of the finest spa resorts in the country lie within reach of Phoenix, Arizona. These desert oases among cacti and magnificent rock formations offer services inspired by the natural elements. Take your pick from the endless variety of treatments, from Asian-inspired to Swedish to stress-eliminating hot stone massages. What could possibly add to the experience? World-class shopping and some of the finest cuisine in the Southwest.

row.site: Las Vegas features more than 30 spa facilities.
row.description: Step away from the energy of the gaming floor at many of Las Vegas's most popular casinos and you'll find a wealth of comforting spa getaways. With more than 30 facilities to choose from, you can explore a wide variety of treatments, from Shiatsu and Swedish massages to aromatherapy, herbal wraps, and reflexology. Having a girls' getaway? Sign up for manicures, pedicures, and facials. Or simply relax in a sauna and let your cares drift away.

row.site: Swedish, Native American, and European Methods are used.
row.description: Santa Fe, New Mexico draws visitors passionate about the healing arts. Experience treatments inspired by Native American, Japanese, and European methods in several specialized spas. Your adventure into renewal and rejuvenation can include explorations into Chinese medicine, modern shamanism, astrology, hypnosis, or just tried-and-true Swedish massage. Best of all, you'll enjoy your spa experience in a city filled with art and natural beauty.

row.site: Swedish, Native American, and European Methods are used.
row.description: Ancient Hawaiians believed in lokahi, the idea that all living things are connected. This spirit suffuses the many spa resorts concentrated in Waikiki. Find your center in a yoga or tai chi session on the beach or a lush, tropical garden. Bathe in the kawehewehe, or "healing waters" of Gray's Beach. And don't forget there's nothing quite as refreshing as a walk on one of Oahu's legendary shorelines at sunrise or sunset.

row.site: Swedish, Native American, and European Methods are used.
row.description: When you partake in an outdoor spa treatment in the calming breezes of Kauai, you're participating in ancient Hawaiian healing practices. Here you'll find deep calm on the beach or beside the sacred Wailua River. You'll experience Lomi Lomi massage, based on the Polynesian idea of huna, meaning "everything seeks love." Beginning with a traditional Hawaiian blessing, this treatment is just the first step in your peaceful journey.

Palm Springs is the traditional getaway for Hollywood celebs seeking a quiet place to refocus their creative energies. Rediscover your own inner peace with hydrotherapy or enjoy an abundance of skin treatments designed to keep you beautiful. Take refuge in a boutique resort spa, or bring your friends along to one of the area's hip and swanky day spas. After a day of pampering, delicious food, and deep relaxation, you'll feel like a movie star.

Among spa aficionados, Palm Beach is known to have "the best of everything." A variety of full-service facilities employ some of the most talented practitioners of European massage techniques you're likely to find. Refocus in spas rated in the top ten by Zagat. Slip into the "Waters of the World," a series of outdoor pools infused with salts and minerals imported from the Dead Sea and French Pyrenees. Afterward, world-class golf and dining await.

row.site: The Four Seasons Resort, Biltmore Hotel
row.description: Seaside luxury beckons travelers to Santa Barbara, California. Enjoy some of the highest of high-end resorts as well as bargains on treatments at rejuvenating day spas. Embark on a wine-tasting tour arranged by your concierge or relax after a day on the golf course with a shiatsu massage. Or simply breathe the salty breeze along some of the area's most beguiling coastline. Santa Barbara provides pleasure in its many forms.

Those seeking the fulfillment of a healing spa experience need look no further than Dallas, Texas. Luxuriate in mud and salt treatments, herbal wraps, and aromatherapy massage at four- and five-star resorts. Start your day with pilates, yoga, or tai chi, then break for a healthy spa cuisine lunch. Traveling with a friend? Try side by side shiatsu massage. And if golf's your game, you'll find the city's sculpted courses world-class.

Discover intimate spas and stunningly beautiful resorts in sun-blessed Naples, Florida. It's a calming place to try new and wondrous methods of relaxation. How about a honeysuckle scrub or frangipani wrap? Let serenity be your guide as you work on the perfect Florida tan or hydrate your skin with a fresh sugarcane treatment. Once you're reinvigorated, hit the courts for some tennis or inhale gentle ocean breezes on a secluded stretch of beach.
